Description: A plaster front-mould for a terracotta model of a ring-footed amphora with beribboned garlands on the shoulder, the ends of the ribbons extending to the body. It has dovetail-shaped registration hollows for aligning the two moulds, two on each edge. The top edge is flattened, with two shallow transverse grooves. White plaster, with damaged surface on the body of the amphora.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Probably Ptolemaic, second or first century BC. Comparanda: The ringed-spike perhaps indicates that the coroplast may have had a Knidian amphora in mind, but the neck and handles are too short (see Grace 1961: figs 64-6); other amphorae also had ringed-spikes.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3670)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
